Key Arguments: The legislation threatens the fundamental human right to freely express opinions and information.
Debate and the exchange of ideas are essential for scientific advancement and should not be limited by legislation.
The public is capable of discerning truth from misinformation without government intervention.
The bill is viewed as a totalitarian power grab.
Notable Quotes: This bill being considered at the moment is nothing short of a totalitarian power grab.
The very basis of science, on which we are told to rely today, is the consideration of robust exchange of information and ideas without the limitations of legislation.
